description: From French zaptieh, from Ottoman Turkish ضبطیه‎ (zaptiye, “policeman”), from Arabic ضَبْطِيَّة‎ (ḍabṭiyya, “policeman”).

examples: 1918,  Aurora Mardiganian,  Ravished Armenia‎[1], page 10:One of the most striking photographs of the deportations that have come out of Armenia. Here is shown a column of Christians on the path across the great plains of the Mamuret-ul-Aziz. The zaptieths are shown walking along at one side.
